title: Electoral Act 1997 (No. 25 of 1997) (as adapted by the Housing, Planning and
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Electoral Act 1997 (Variation of
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Electoral Act 1997 (Variation of 

Monetary Amounts) Order 2024.
text_norm: 1 order may cited electoral act 1997 (variation monetary amounts) order 2024

title: Electoral Act 1997 (No. 25 of 1997) (as adapted by the Housing, Planning and
heading: In the Electoral Act 1997 (No. 25 of 1997) the monetary amount
text_raw:
2. 

In the Electoral Act 1997 (No. 25 of 1997) the monetary amount 

specified in— 

(a) 

section 21(1)(b)(i), is varied to an amount of €11,200, and 

(b) 

section 32(1)(a), is varied to— 

(i) 

in subparagraph (i), an amount of €38,900, 

(ii) 

in subparagraph (ii), an amount of €48,600, and 

(iii) 

in subparagraph (iii), an amount of €58,350.
text_norm: 2 electoral act 1997 (no 25 1997) monetary amount specified in-- (a) section 21(1)(b)(i) varied amount eur11 200 (b) section 32(1)(a) varied to-- (i) subparagraph (i) amount eur38 900 (ii) subparagraph (ii) amount eur48 600 (iii) subparagraph (iii) amount eur58 350

title: Electoral Act 1997 (No. 25 of 1997) (as adapted by the Housing, Planning and
heading: 3. The Electoral Act 1997 (Limitation and Reimbursement of Election
text_raw:
3. The Electoral Act 1997 (Limitation and Reimbursement of Election 

Expenses at Dáil Election) Order 2007 (S.I. No. 113 of 2007) is revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

18 October, 2024. 

DARRAH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 22nd October, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [545] 3

title: Electoral Act 1997 (No. 25 of 1997) (as adapted by the Housing, Planning and
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This order varies, in line with changes in the Consumer Price Index, the 
maximum amounts of expenditure which may be incurred by or on behalf of a 
candidate in a Dáil election to €38,900 in a 3-seat constituency; €48,600 in a 4seat constituency; and €58,350 in a 5-seat constituency. It also provides, in line 
with the changes in the Consumer Price Index, that the amount of election 
expenses which may be reimbursed to a candidate at a Dáil election is the actual 
expenses or €11,200, whichever is the less. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [545]
